item.title: Report E-2024020245
item.description:
Report E-2024020245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN1814 Ferro-Terj 1070 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of a poly containment. The valve was secured with a zip tie for shipment on. The released product was neutralized and collected with absorbent pads. All waste was staged into a 5-gallon poly lined metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020192
item.description:
Report E-2024020192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 5, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was damaged in transit due to unknown causes and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN3098 for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and pavement and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, FCE personnel utilized a neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to collect all residual product. All UN3098 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums that were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024020146
item.description:
Report E-2024020146

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 1, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3082-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews observed that they would not be able to lift the tote for a gravity feed and instead did a bucket transfer of all the remaining contents into an additional 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents, clean up debris, and cut up 330-gallon tote were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found 1-6 at 0200 in the unload area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: carton had a loose lid which caused leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a plastic tote

  • Description: See attached document: Exhibit 1 01.13.2024 Release Incident Timeline The 21 1/2" trailer dome lid was not secured. The dome lid is located top rear center of the trailer. The release began sometime between 0841 and 0847. The release concluded at 0858. The remediation completed at 2200. (estimated 13h 20m) A combination of dry sand and soda ash was spread over the release areas to neutralize the Sulfuric Acid. The debris was collected and placed in roll off containers for disposal.

It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024020066
item.description:
Report X-2024020066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS IN A SPILL TUB ON THE HAZMAT TABLE. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO SPILL WITH FULL PPE ON AND OPENED UP PACKAGE. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THERE WAS A BOX WITHIN A BOX AND IT HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL ON IT WITH 6 BOTTLES OF PRESTONE DE-ICER. THERE WERE ALSO 6 LOOSE BOTTLES OF PRESTONE DE-ICER AND ONE OF THEM WAS LEAKING. THERE WAS NOT ANY LABELS ON THE OUTER CARTON SO RESPONDER CALLED THE HAZMAT MATERIAL HOTLINE AND PROCESSED US UNDECLARED THROUGH DMP.
